I was a bit disappointed with this course. I felt that there was a lot of content which was self-evident, and not presented in a very interesting way (also some links to Youtube/other resources easily found on the internet). I particularly found the male presenter quite boring. I believe the course was more for sales people and entrepreneurs trying to pitch their ideas to investors (the last chapter was focused on that). I had wanted to use it to improve my skills in influencing people in my organization. I did learn some nifty ideas on stucturing presentations and also on how to deal with questions. I didn't feel the 'storytelling' angle was well covered.

Overall very good course content and with lots of additional reading materials. The presenters really know their content and are pleasant to listen to, easy to understand and follow. There was however this one thing I would have loved to see a little more and may be these were just my personal expectations based on where I am coming from and what I was really looking forward to learning. A little more depth into story telling and more examples and exercises or quizzes that upped my knowledge and grasp.  While "group dynamics" and "dealing with questions and objections" were all very important aspects of  influencing, I was looking for a little more emphasis on the story telling side of it. Anyway - great content, well structured too. One feedback I would like to leave for the presenters is that at times I found the Acronyms a little forced or "one too many". The one with the many "I"s at the end ... just too long and forced, not very intuitive. But can't deny that it covers a lot of valuable perspectives and thought.   This is my first time on coursera, I just think that the quizzes to pass are a little on the easy size; did not challenge me enough and very often did not cover many aspects of the topics covered. Thank you Lawrence and Arabella - loved both of you for your own styles and approach and the love both of you have for sharing knowledge.
The course is well-constructed and both the instructors are really good. I would suggest adding more examples and case studies,and lesser theories.
